meanings.definition: To make something longer than necessary or desired.
meanings.sent1: She kept overlengthening the dress, making it too big for her.
meanings.sent2: The tailor warned against overlengthening the curtains, as it might ruin the look.
meanings.sent3: The overlengthening of the road sign made it impossible to read the directions clearly.
meanings.sent4: His tendency to overlengthen his stories often led to listeners losing interest.
meanings.sent5: Overlengthening the rope beyond its capacity caused it to snap under pressure.

meanings.definition: The act of extending something beyond its normal length.
meanings.sent1: The overlengthening of the bridge made it stand out among the other structures.
meanings.sent2: The overlengthening of the hair extensions gave her a unique and stylish look.
meanings.sent3: The overlengthening of the meeting due to off-topic discussions frustrated everyone present.
meanings.sent4: The overlengthening of the movie resulted in many viewers leaving the theater before it ended.
meanings.sent5: The overlengthening of the garden hose made it challenging to store properly.
